title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 302.11 - Signalling; U turns; backing vehicles
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 302.11 - Signalling; U turns; backing vehicles

State Regulations

Before starting, stopping, backing or turning, drivers of all
vehicles shall make certain that such movement can be made in safety and an
appropriate signal by means of the hand or arm or by a mechanical or electrical
device shall be given. No U turns shall be made except under the direction of a
member of the toll force or police department. No person shall back a vehicle
at the toll booth except under the direction of a member of the toll force or
police department. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21

302.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
